website_summaries.verdict: A good choice if you are looking for a modern shovel that limits back-straining motions, but it won't work for everyone or all snow storms.
pros: Unique design sports an additional spring-loaded handle that cuts down on bending and sprain, making it a good choice for consumers with lower-back problems
cons: A bit awkward for taller individuals to use
Not ideal for thick, heavy snow
A few longevity concerns noted, but the warranty adds peace of mind

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 1 day
customer_reviews.text: I was shoveling and it was working great! However the second day I went to use it the metal shield on the shovel broke off. The form factor is great but the fragile shovel part is causing me to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas

customer_reviews.title: Back Saver but......
customer_reviews.text: From the picture the main handle looked like it was adjustable for height with that wing nut midway, it's not. Glad I'm not much taller, otherwise I would have to bend over anyways to use this shovel while holding both D-handles. Seems well built for the most part (made in China if that matters) and does make it easier on my back. Time will tell how tough the aluminum metal edge will stay on plastic shovel edge though, being there's no sturdy rivets attaching that. It's just pressed on with 5 small dimples into metal, only on one side, to hold it onto the plastic shovel edge. Hmmm....
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Twist to the conventional snow shovel!!
customer_reviews.text: These bad boys are a TOTAL back saver!! I've ordered five of them... I have a crew of four up on the roof of our motel clearing off over 3' of snow (on a 300 ft. run of roof!!) and THEY love them too. I've shoveled several hundred pounds of the white stuff myself, and I gotta tell ya, I will NEVER use a "regular" snow shovel again! Having that extra handle is a God-Send!! If you're [semi] old :-) like me (60) or a young buck that just needs something that will fling the snow WAY out of the way - GET YOURSELF one or more of these! You'll LOVE it!!
customer_reviews.author: MotelMan

customer_reviews.title: Snow Joe SJ-SHLV01
customer_reviews.text: I used this shovel to clear out a driveway covered with 10" of snow. It was more of a good cardio workout than backbreaking labor thanks to that 2nd handle. The aluminum edge is sharp enough to cut through crusty snow, but it's not dangerously sharp like a sword or anything. It seems to glide well over ice and concrete without being too snaggy or clingy. The bolt and wingnut on the main handle allow for disassembly, but not length adjustment. My digital bath scale says it weighs about 3.6 lbs. This is a well-designed and well-built product made of premium materials. I believe it will last for many seasons.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Tiangco

customer_reviews.title: The metal gaurd on the shovel that is supposed to ...
customer_reviews.text: The metal gaurd on the shovel that is supposed to protect the plastic comes off, it should have been screwed or riveted on.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product
customer_reviews.text: It’s a gimmick the product doesn’t work the shovel holds almost no snow. The extra handle doesn’t do anything it actually makes it harder to shovel the snow since now you need lift 5 times as many times. The metal at the endgenof the shovel will get stuck on every uneven part of the sidewalk. Bad product overall.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Rosa

customer_reviews.title: Great shovel - improvement on lower back strain
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical. But this really is helpful on the lower back. You can nearly stand vertically while tossing the snow. The only thing it's not great at is chipping away at any packed down snow. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Best snow shovel ever
customer_reviews.text: Bought this shovel at the end of last winter, but never got the chance to try it out. Yesterday we had our first snow, so I went out with my new shovel and I LOVE IT! SO much easier than a regular straight one. Better then the bent "ergonomic" one we have, too. The extra handle makes it so I don't have to bend over nearly as far, and helps with lifting and dumping. It's very lightweight, and the metal edge helps cut through packed down spots. Price is great, too. I'll be getting one for the back yard.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: 50" tall will also help
customer_reviews.text: The smaller handle is not a pole, it's like an aluminum or steel strip. So I don't know how long lasting it will be. Haven't used it yet because it's 9 degrees F. But I do see how it will minimize stooping over when there isn't enough snow to use a snow blower (under 4 inches). From bottom of the shovel blade to the top of the large handle, it is 50" tall which also will help. The shovel surface is 18" x 13 1/2".
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend NOT buying
customer_reviews.text: Let me first say that if I could give this product ZERO stars, I would! The metal blade along the bottom causes the shovel to grip/stick to the pavement horribly. There is no smooth shoveling motion. You are not able to push the snow off the sidewalk or driveway. We also have a trex deck on our house and had the same issue. We tried the shovel on both light fluffy snow as well as heavy wet snow. I would return the product but already threw the box away. Very disappointed. Also, not sure that the additional handle really helps.
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: Broken pressure pin just putting it together
customer_reviews.text: This review is tbd when the snow gets here. When putting the pole and shovel together the pressure pin in the pole already broke off and i cant get the shovel head off at all. My hope is that it stays on without the pressure pin in place, else the shovel head will just fall off during use.
customer_reviews.author: Trena

customer_reviews.title: This shovel is amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: This shovel is amazing!! It's the first two handed shovel I've seen and it works even better than I thought it would! It really saved my back because I didn't have to bend over much at all to use since I was using both hands. It also gave me the lift power to lift up the snow and launch it off the driveway when needed. I was able to get the snow off the driveway faster and with much less back pain! Worth every penny!!! I thank whoever invented these things!! Of course it can be used in the normal way to push snow off the sidewalk or driveway but I usually use the two handed mode more.
customer_reviews.author: MichaelL

customer_reviews.title: if you want something lightweight this is for you...
customer_reviews.text: ...but that is NOT what a sturdy snow shovel should be. The scoop is plastic! If I missed that in the description, that's my fault. But a very slim, relative small box arrived which means that it requires assembly (that part was easy). The shovel is in three parts so that means in three places there is weakness built in. I have never seen a snow shovel that was in pieces and that is NOT what I want for sturdiness. Returned immediately.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonUser

customer_reviews.title: Surprised
customer_reviews.text: To be honest, I saw the extra handle and I thought to myself: "This flmsy thing is going to break after the first hard snow, and I don't know why we bought two!" But then I used it and it was surprisingly effective! Lifting your shovel full of snow doesn't require a major back strain and I finished our driveway within a half hour. Pleasantly surprised and pleased with the outcome of this purchase. That'll do, Snow Joe. That'll do
customer_reviews.author: Elise

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy Alibaba garbage that smashes your knuckles
customer_reviews.text: The assist handle is a flat strip of metal that wobbles for a so-called “spring assist”. So what really happens is you lift the snow up and it flexes up, which makes it more difficult to lift the snow. Then you throw the snow, and it flexes down and smashes your knuckles. Literally makes no sense. And like others have said, the wear strip is comically weak. It’s better to just go all plastic instead of having the aluminum-foil-soft wear strip. I immediately returned it.
customer_reviews.author: theonlyrealreview

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't scrape snow very well, hard to use
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how difficult it is to use this shovel. Very disappointing. The handle doesn't really do much to prevent back pain, and the bottom part of the shovel is very hard to use on snow closer to the ground. There is no where to put your foot on to press forward. Seems pretty flimsy, and too short. We've used it 3 times now and it's by far one of the worst shovels we've used. This would probably work fine in the warmer states, where they get less than an inch of snow sporadically, but don't bother if you get snow regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Scruggs

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time, it's not tough enough to actually work
customer_reviews.text: While the shovel is ergonomic, it's far too flimsy to be of any use. I live in Minneapolis so I've used a shovel or 2 before. This shovel didn’t make it through 1 snowstorm before it was useless. The shovel blade is far too flimsy, the metal "reinforcement" is as rigid as a soda can. After about 15 seconds of use it was so bent and disfigured it was leaving a lot of snow on my sidewalk that was going under the misshapen blade. You need to stop and straighten the blade nearly every shovelfull. Don't waste your time or money on this. I would give it zero stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: D. Fjeld

customer_reviews.title: It did not save my back
customer_reviews.text: I have to be pretty harsh here because one of the claims is that it helps save your back. This was not the case for me. I think it has potential but it needs improvement. I think I would rather use this than a normal shovel but the second handle just isn't long enough. My back is killing me. It was some pretty heavy wet snow though but I feel like this product sells short on its promises.
customer_reviews.author: Jameson Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight shovel that can stand up to a Minnesota winter!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this exactly 2 years ago December 3, 2017. It has become “my” shovel. I like it because it’s lightweight and because at my age, nearly 71, it’s pretty easy to maneuver. We just got hit with a blizzard which deposited 20 inches of snow. As you can see, my house received considerably more than 20 inches. I had to shovel off a deck with 4 feet of snow. Not fun but the lightweight shovel held up to it. Since I’ve had it two years and I live in Northeast Minnesota, I would say it’s sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Vee Ess

customer_reviews.title: This is my go to snow shovel!!!
customer_reviews.text: I used this shovel for 3 winters and 2 of them were the worst I’ve ever experienced. The extra handle made it super easy to lift the snow load once on the shovel. I would recommend this shovel to anyone! I do however need to replace it after the third winter because the metal holding the edge has began to curl and causes damage to some of my surfaces. I would add however this is probably due to the fact that I used the corners frequently like a pick axe and that was not what the shovel edge was intended for. It did hold up for three years of this though and I would call that a tough shovel!!!
customer_reviews.author: J. Dorman

customer_reviews.title: Easy on the back.
customer_reviews.text: After all the snow last year I wanted a shovel that didn't strain my back so much. The second handle on this intrigued me so I gave it a try. We got our first snow on Thanksgiving and this shovel worked unbelievably well. Having the second handle took so much strain off the back. I can't speak for its longevity yet but it feels like it's make from solid materials.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Tingle

customer_reviews.title: Excellent. Lightweight and does the job
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a snow shovel that was both lightweight and could be pushed along my deck with ease. This shovel really surprised me. I don't usually write reviews unless I really love a product and this one was so affordable I had my doubts however it does everything it's supposed to. Because it's like way too easy on my back. I love having the two handles to hold on to it makes lifting it much easier and I am able to effortlessly push no off my deck without even lifting it. The quality sings really good as well. This is my first season using it, however after several snowstorms I can highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Aldengal

customer_reviews.title: interesting piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this because it looked interesting but that small extra handle made carrying the snow you scoop easier but beware what you put on the shovel does not get lighter once the shovel is off the ground. Lifting the load is easier but once lifted you support the load yourself so don't let the easy lifting fool you. as far as the back I'm not sure how it helps, I was taking way bigger piles of snow than I should so my back was going to be sore regardless I feel.
customer_reviews.author: Danie-rich

customer_reviews.title: Great For Heavy Snow
customer_reviews.text: I've been shoveling snow in the northern US for around 20 years and this is a great shovel for heavy snow. It allows for more leverage without bending over causing less stress to mid and lower back muscles. This product is a great example of working smarter not harder. If you have fluffy light snow I would advise getting a push shovel (or both) as this one is more suited for lifting and digging medium/heavy more dense snow. Where I live when the plow comes by the end of the drive way usually has a large mound which this shovel handles very well. Overall pretty sturdy too.
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: Great shovel for many but not all
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - The extra handle really does make it easier to throw snow. - Very light. I'm sure there are lighter shovels out there, but this was great already. Cons: - Not great material quality. About what you'd expect for the price. The scoop has already bent a little after just a couple uses. Works okay for me, but for people who live in a harsher climate with tons of snow, I'm not sure how well this shovel would hold up. If you're really good about shoveling immediately after a snow storm, this shovel should last fine. But, once snow gets hard, this shovel just isn't tough enough to handle it.
customer_reviews.author: Aubri Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Finally a decent shovel
customer_reviews.text: I could not wait to get a decent shovel that would not break my back. I assembled it and removed a couple of shovelfuls but the storm and need to shovel had already passed. The remaining snow has almost all melted but I will have it ready for our next storm. I am just so happy to have a decent shovel that is not 40 plus years old and worn out. It seems to work and it appears that it will last me a long time but only time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Lavoie

customer_reviews.title: Looks strange, works great (save your back and shovel easier)
customer_reviews.text: Works even better than expected. No bending at all, able to toss snow so much easier than a "regular" shovel. Quality of product is very good, figure it will last a few seasons. Update - after 1 winter of use (there was a lot of snow) the metal strip on the front came loose and went "somewhere" - still not certain where. For that, I downgraded from 5 to 4 stars. Still, the extra handle is back saving, and just for that I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: sherm624

customer_reviews.title: Overrated Shovel
customer_reviews.text: We finally got a big snow and got a chance to put this thing to use. Overall this shovel does NOT live up to the hype. PROS: - It's lightweight - The handle helps in spots where you have to "throw" the snow you're shoveling CONS: - The shovel is too short, which kills your back (I'm just 5'9" and I felt I had to stoop too much with this shovel) - The shovel is too small (my other shovels "hold" more snow) - The little white strap that holds the extra handle in place for storage fell off on first use. It's out there in the show somewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Quaker

customer_reviews.title: What a difference and Excellent design
customer_reviews.text: Once in a while you get a product that really deserve a reward. This is one of those product. I've used it today. Wow, what a difference. It makes me wonder why no one think of this before. Even if you have no back problem, this makes shoveling so much easier. The only thing is I don't know how tough this thing is. I will update later.
customer_reviews.author: Leo Lee

customer_reviews.title: The most comfortable shovel I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: The most comfortable shovel I have ever used. It could have a wider blade but does a decent job. Durability I am a bit skeptical and don’t expect it to last a long time. Maybe 1-2 seasons but most of my shovels last that long. I am expecting the metal blade to go first. Not fastened very well. But until then it is working great.
customer_reviews.author: J. Loomis

customer_reviews.title: It moves snow quickly. Even wet, frozen snow.
customer_reviews.text: This is very effective at moving snow. I used it for the first time today. It moved the icy, wet snow very quickly. My only complaint is that it seems to require a very shallow angle of attack in order to avoid catching on every little bump in the pavement. I'm short and I had to stoop a bit in order to apply the shovel edge in a shallow enough angle to keep from doing that. I'll keep using it because it does work but I'd love it if I could stand up straighter in order to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Meotzi

customer_reviews.title: Extra handle is handy
customer_reviews.text: You can ignore the extra handle for the most part and use it as a regular shovel. In that regard it is solid and effective. However you can also shovel snow straight forward using the extra handle to get added leverage. This puts the force on your shoulders rather than your back. So a combination of the two methods worked well for me.
customer_reviews.author: A.

customer_reviews.title: Works well for me
customer_reviews.text: I see a couple bad reviews for this shovel and I was hesitant, but I decided to give it a go. For the one time that I used it, it was easy to use and it felt lighter than a normal shovel. I was able to clear a lot of ice in my front yard with it. I can't comment on the durability though since I only used it once. But hopefully it can last.
customer_reviews.author: Jojojoshua

customer_reviews.title: Snow Joe
customer_reviews.text: I live in the Upper Peninsula of Michigan. 200 to 300 inches of snow is the norm. Rearranging the snow in my yard is like having a part time job. The Snow Joe was my go to shovel this last winter. The extra handle seemed to allow me to throw the snow farther with less strain. With the amount of snow we get this is quite important. I wasn't sure how it would hold up under the workout I gave it but it's good to go for another season. I am happy with this purchase. Tim
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: An excellent find
customer_reviews.text: I've have to shovel every winter, and I'm surprised I have not found this shovel until now. This shovel came disassembled and was very easy to put together. Only a few pieces. I have a second different shovel that does not have the extra handle, and it doesn't get any use. This shovel really does wonders for your back. Being that my parents are getting older, I purchased this shovel for them as well after personally seeing how easy it makes shoveling. You hardly have to bend when using this shovel. Great tool for back safety! 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Junior FM

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than one light season & not very ergonomic
customer_reviews.text: Purchased based on ratings and reviews. Found that the ergonomic feature isn't that great, and it's better to push snow, anyway. Even when lifting show, I did it without the extra handle, which was often in the way, and I rigged that handle to stay fixed. I owned it through one very mild, little-snow winter, and then started to use when it snowed this winter. Very quickly, the metal edge detached itself, and won't stay attached. Not very useful with just a plastic edge. Sorry for this late review, but when the shovel fell apart a few months ago, reviews were disabled for this product! (That's one way to avoid poor reviews... (:
customer_reviews.author: Heffy

customer_reviews.title: This 47 year old loves it.
customer_reviews.text: Granted we had almost all light weight fluffy and easy to shovel snow this winter, I loved this shovel. You don’t have to put your lower hands down low like on on a regular shovel. That means no bending over. You still are shoveling snow, so don’t think using this is as easy as paying the neighbor kids $5 to do it. But it really really is easy on the back and makes each load seem a lot lighter. It really scrapes the ground well too. Gets down in there and you see concrete after each pass.
customer_reviews.author: Willie V

customer_reviews.title: Eh - Not exactly what I had hoped.
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this shovel and it is/was really needed with the snow we got this week. So when it arrived and we put it to use, we were a little sad to see that it still required us to hunch over. I also feel like the blade at the bottom isn't really tough enough and it's sorta has this funny slight ripple in it so it doesn't scrape very well. I don't normally give bad reviews. But if it were me, I would probably order a different one with a better blade at the bottom. The extra handle is nice for when you are flinging the snow somewhere but it doesn't really help on the shoveling piece.
customer_reviews.author: B. Owen

customer_reviews.title: Works good but might not net the same results depending on your height!
customer_reviews.text: We had our first snow here and finally broke open the shovel. Overall it helps having the second handle but will see the true test in a bigger snow event. As others have noted that depending no your height you might end up using it differently and might not net the same advantages. Only other concern is the bottom lip might not hold up long enough and might break off in a couple years. AMS
customer_reviews.author: AMS

customer_reviews.title: really like shovel
customer_reviews.text: I really like the extra handle and it makes the shovel much easier to toss without pulling on your back. Only used one time, but really like it so far. The ice scraper is just what I was looking for. Checked at stores for a metal edged window scraper for car and they only had plastic, which with ice never works well. I had an old ice scraper for years with a metal edge and really liked it, but when it disappeared, I never could find one I like. this one looks almost like the one I had before, but is bigger. I really like this one.
customer_reviews.author: goldie

customer_reviews.title: Great shovel
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new snow shovel after my old one cracked all to pieces thanks to shoveling ice (well, trying to shovel ice). I don't have back problems, but I'm really not strong and thought the double handle would make it easier on me...and it did. Durability has been fine, no cracks or anything after 2+ winters (although this past winter I didn't need to use it more than once, if at all). I'm very happy with it, and if it breaks, I'd likely get another or something similar.
customer_reviews.author: GK

customer_reviews.title: Did NOT like.
customer_reviews.text: I guess I didn’t realize that the assist handle was mounted to spring steel and doesn’t clip back against the main handle when not in use like a previous shovel I owned. The curvature of the main handle on Ames and True Temper (some models) is good enough to replicate the mechanical advantage that is achieved through this floppy assist handle but they store flatter. I hate the floppy appendage and I would not recommend this product as there are better alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: AverageWhiteGuy

customer_reviews.title: Works well. Wish there was a version for taller people.
customer_reviews.text: This feels good to use and moves snow easily. It is a bit short, however, and being 6'4" I would pay a few extra bucks for a big and tall version because I'm stooping with this. Even still, I prefer it over other shovels I've used over the years. A great springy innovation. Reasonable price. Good warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Will S.

customer_reviews.title: I really like using this shovel
customer_reviews.text: This is a super effective and convenient shovel. I've had it for 2 seasons so far. This last season was especially heavy on snow and the shovel has lost the metal piece that goes along the bottom. I also noticed that snow was really sticking to it a lot more toward the end of the season and making it heavier to through snow. I'm not sure if some kind of coating got worn out or what, but even though I need to replace it at this point I feel like it was worth it for the time I've had it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Lance Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for an old lady, light and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I love this shovel in that it is very light and easy to use with both hands. Back strain definitely minimized and I can work my way up the driveway in no time. I hesitate to hit the hardened snow very hard because it has an aluminum lip on a plastic shovel. Having said that, I just alternate this shovel with an all aluminum one for harder snow. This item works fantastic on powdery snow, much easier to use than the aluminum shovels. The extra handle is a bit awkward to get used to but in not time I developed technique and now I shovel upright with no back strain.
customer_reviews.author: Maria H AD

customer_reviews.title: ERGO is the way to dig yourself out!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, WA gets snow and we got and will again get hit. Just received, assembled and used. Assembly is ez - 3 parts - blade, main handle and ergo handle - use care when cutting zip tie - squeeze the 2 parts together with one hand n I cut with pruning shears. Assemble is a no brainier, removes snow ez and ergo handle makes my back happy - 1 issue - lite weight make breaking up ice hard - so have ur old school shovel handy if need to remove ice - that's why i gave 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: P. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: More Like Strain-Inducing Snow Shovel
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this shovel. I've been happy with my previous sun/snow joe products... but this is garbage. The aluminum strip bent immediately, the strain-reducing handle was great for my 3 year-old.... but not a 6 foot male trying to shovel 5 inches of snow. I actually strained myself using this thing. The shovel itself doesn't hold much snow. Storing this shovel is also a pain. I will stick with my walmart shovels. I would recommend this for a short elderly person living in a condo with not much sidewalk. This shovel isn't for an area with a lot of snow or someone taking care of a lot of snow in a hurry.
customer_reviews.author: mrsunshine58

customer_reviews.title: It's ok, I see no difference between standard shovels and this though.
customer_reviews.text: It's just ok. The handle is a bit short (I'm 5'9"") and I easily get back aches with this as well as my traditional snow shovel. Seems to be well made, but the handle joining screw comes loose frequently. It's not bad enough to return though, so its's been relegated to my porch/deck shovel.
customer_reviews.author: D. Moler

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I live in the Burbs of Chicago, and We got hit with a major snow storm this month of Jan. It was like no one already had shovels and they were all sold out at stores. Thus, buying online. between it snowing, and raining turning it to ice, than snowing. This is powerful enough to actually pick up the snow. Now I just need someone that can lift the snow with the shovel and ill be all good. I have so much snow that needs to be shoveled. I might need a plow truck instead. tee Hee
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: the handle broke right away and now i can barely use it
customer_reviews.author: Mlaw

customer_reviews.title: Great for small women...
customer_reviews.text: I am a 5 foot, 73 year old woman and used this for the first time today. Once I got the hang of it, this little shovel was very easy to use. And so light weight! I highly recommend this to anyone not too tall and without a lot of body strength. I still can't believe what I was able to do.
customer_reviews.author: Debby Ann

customer_reviews.title: 2 year warranty needs to be erased lasted less then 6 times metal blade falls off
customer_reviews.text: Great shovel and great idea but someone dropped the ball on the metal blade nothing holds it in place rivets etc. once it comes off might as well throw it in the trash as you will break the plastic #shovelutionturnedsnowjunk. If Snow Joe could operate a rivet gun this would get a 5 star review
customer_reviews.author: tom henry

customer_reviews.title: Snowmagedon be gone
customer_reviews.text: We had a giant snow storm in our area and these arrived just in time for us to use them. I had to shovel my drive way around 6-7 times and my shoulder or lower back were not in pain like usual. I love this purchase and am so grateful I made it. My muscles and lower back thanked me big time.
customer_reviews.author: cherize

customer_reviews.title: Nice product - better on the back!
customer_reviews.text: I really do like this shovel....it's much easier on the back, using that second handle. It seems pretty sturdy, although the plastic shovel feels less durable than a metal one, so not as good if there's ice involved. While shoveling recently, something on the handle "turned" a little, so I think I need to take it inside and perhaps tighten something. But it really does make walk-shoveling easier...don't have to bend and pull my back muscles to lift and throw the snow. It's kinda' fun to use!
customer_reviews.author: presbygirl

customer_reviews.title: My back thanks you!
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit, I was a little skeptical..but this shovel really did allow me to lift and throw the snow without hurting my back. I am 71 now and my lower back has always been weak and an issue when lifting anything. This shovel does what it says it does and I couldn't be happier. The snow we have this year has to be thrown higher than ever. The second picture shows my deck after I shoveled it and threw the snow with this SnowJoe.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma 13

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw
customer_reviews.text: I knew from other reviewers not to overload this “lightweight” shovel, so that wasn’t an issue for me. But the large plastic thumbscrew that connects the two sections of the longer handle is in the wrong place! It’s about 3 inches long and sticks out about an inch. That big thing should be on the upper edge, not the side, of the pole so that it doesn’t get in the way of your movement. I switch hands often as I shovel, and when my left hand is on the upper handle, that big piece bumps and bruises my leg unless I remain vigilant. I’m 5’3”.
customer_reviews.author: Pianomann

customer_reviews.title: Worth a try for back problems
customer_reviews.text: This shovel is a really nice concept for flinging snow, especially the heavy stuff left my the snow plow. I’m knocking it down one star for the handle length. I have another ergonomic shovel that works a bit better because I don’t have to bend as much to gather the snow onto the shovel. I’m only 5’7” and had to bed quite a bit with this one. However it is unmatched for lifting
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: It comes with a warranty
customer_reviews.text: I have never bought a shovel with a warranty before but this one has one. Aside from the metal edge and it being new, this shovel makes clearing that fluffy white stuff easier than my last back saver shovel. You can throw snow further and scoop more since this shovel is so light weight. Just use caution as it is light and left my hands a couple of time. Definitely looking in to other products from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Chaddo82443

customer_reviews.title: About what $20 will get you
customer_reviews.text: Interesting concept, but the secondaryspring handle would work better as a rigid set handle. Seen reviewers complain its cheaply made and over priced. Not sure what they paid but I paid $20, not a lot of money to me. I still have to stoop to scoop you will to if you're over 6'. Get a measuring tape and see what 18" in real time not your minds eye is first, its pretty narrow
customer_reviews.author: Christoph

customer_reviews.title: Revolutionary!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been through quite a few shovels, from 26” blade “man plows” to cheap Walmart shovels, and everything in between. For heavy Colorado snow, you CANNOT do better than this bad boy. The second handle makes tossing the snow onto your grass SO much easier! There’s a lot less stooping and a lot more energy for clearing the snow. I’m 5’3” and found this shovel to be EXCELLENT. I may never buy another kind of shovel again!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Awesome...a MUST have in snowy climate.
customer_reviews.text: My first New Hampshire snowfall of 12". My first EVER having to clear snow. These snowshovels are awesome. My back is fine (normally would be killing me with this type of activity) and I used these to clear alot of snow. Excellent. I love them. I am ordering for my car (wish you had an easier fold up version but this one snaps apart and is fine). How about a bag for the car to hold it? water proof perhaps?
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Easier on my back
customer_reviews.text: This does in fact seem to be easier to use than a regular snow shovel because the extra handle spreads the weight over both arms and shoulders. This is highly subjective of course so your experience may be different. They clearly gave a lot of thought into making it lightweight and I suspect this will affect durability but we haven't used it much yet. There is a metal (I think it's aluminum) strip along the leading edge of the shovel and that will help with durability.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: I’m the weakest person I know and I could do it!
customer_reviews.text: Ok so I’ve been waiting to test this thing out and it DUMPED snow today. I’m very out of shape and get worn out quickly. My neighbor was telling me how heavy the snow was when she just did hers so I figured I had better get out there and do mine too before it settled even more. The snow felt so light to me! I did both my front sidewalk and the path to my front door and I only had to stop to catch my breath once. Super impressed with this shovel!!
customer_reviews.author: RedHeadJKB

customer_reviews.title: The additional spring loaded handle makes it great so that you do not have to stoop over ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been telling my friends and co-workers about this and also posted about it on my social media. Definitely a back saver. The additional spring loaded handle makes it great so that you do not have to stoop over as much to lift up the snow. The shovel also works like the slogan says; spring it and fling it. The majority of the shovel is plastic, so it's light weight. For the price, if it lasts one or two seasons, I'll be happy.
customer_reviews.author: theChivefan

customer_reviews.title: The second handle is handy
customer_reviews.text: I really wasn't sure about this shovel when it first arrived, but now we've used it 5-6 times this winter and it's growing on me. The lower handle is definitely helpful in tossing snow. Much less pressure on your back when you use it. The bottom of the shovel is sharp and it slides fairly well across the driveway. I would buy it again. My only complaint is it's hard to secure the bottom handle so that it can be stored hanging up.
customer_reviews.author: AvidReviewer

customer_reviews.title: Easy on the back
customer_reviews.text: I just moved from Texas to Colorado and have no experience with shoveling snow. I purchased this particular snow shovel because I have a history of lower back pain. Luckily (cuz I'm a skier) we have gotten a lot of snow this winter so I have used this shovel a lot. I have found it easy to lift and move snow and I have had no back pain. The handle fits well and I never feel like I have to bend over to lift snow. I would highly recommend this shovel to anyone with back issues or anyone who would like to avoid it.
customer_reviews.author: Bubbadacat

customer_reviews.title: Poor construction
customer_reviews.text: Although I like how this shovel works, its metal strip came off and got lost in the snow after about the 2nd or 3rd time I used it. I didn't notice the metal strip was missing until the plastic started getting worn down at the end. In addition to having a poor connection, the metal strip itself is much too thin in the first place. I am contacting the manufacturer through their support website. I'll update this review after receiving a response from them.
customer_reviews.author: KBW

customer_reviews.title: A great different
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought this for me as a Christmas gift. I reluctantly gave it a try this season. I am very happy with it. I could use it as a snow pusher on the light days and when I need to throw , it works great. I had a " bent" shovel for many years. I found this shovel easier on the back and can angle the shovel to get all of the snow instead of that pesky layer left behind using the bent shovel.
customer_reviews.author: Jim H

customer_reviews.title: Gimmick handle , low quality materials
customer_reviews.text: Low quality matierials. I’ve used it 4 times to shovel our small driveway and the metal strip is already worn down on both ends. It’s a very soft metal that catches on the concrete surface, making it hard to shovel smoothly. I bought a true temper from Lowe’s, And the quality is night and day. The handle is pointless, it usually don’t even try to use it and it just wobbles around.
customer_reviews.author: Brodieman

customer_reviews.title: Best shovel I have owned
customer_reviews.text: I really didn't know what to expect with the shovel. I have used several variations of snow shovels and this by far is the easiest on your back and is very natural to move and throw snow. It is very lightweight and appears to be well made so far. I have used it in a couple storms and I couldn't be happier. Don't buy a bent angle shovel or another type because they truly don't help your back out like this one does.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Shovel Worth Using
customer_reviews.text: I don't know that you will notice a massive difference between this and a traditional shovel, but it does seem to be most effective in a push/plow and fling style of shoveling. The forward handle gives you better leverage. After several heavy Colorado snowfalls, it has shown to be sturdy enough to not only use in a traditional manner, but also to invert it and use as a scraper for compacted snow.
customer_reviews.author: C. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: worst shovel ever
customer_reviews.text: Sounds revolutionary but unfortunately it is worthless. This is the worst snow shovel I have ever owned. The biting edge is cheap, flimsy and catches on everything. The scoop is also just as flimsy and makes shoveling up broken ice damned near impossible (talking 1/2 and inch or so thick here). The handle is just as weak and after seeing other reviews I wish I had dug into them a little more before purchasing. Save your money and buy a much better one pretty much anywhere else.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Prowse

customer_reviews.title: Good Sturdy Shovel
customer_reviews.text: I've shoveled piles of snow with this a few times now with no problems. It's easy to use and did not give me any muscle aches like a normal snow shovel would. I'm not sure what people are doing to break these. Maybe they're standing on them or not putting them together correctly since they require some assembly. I would buy a second one of these for another family member, friend or neighbor, or to keep in the car. It's a life changer in the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Melody Rindfuss

customer_reviews.title: Another Awesome Product by Snow Joe
customer_reviews.text: I love this snow joe. I had to shovel last week and found my shovel bit the dust. So I jumped on the computer and ordered one 2 days on Amazon. It came all boxed really well and super fast. I put it together, it is easy and then checked out a you tube video to make sure I had the correct body mechanics while using and it is a piece of cake and we have really heavy wet snow in Maine. My back wants to collapse after shoveling. Well no more. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Not all purpose
customer_reviews.text: I don't care for it. It does make the lift lighter and able to throw it farther. But it does not push the snow well and the handle is too short. I think it will be good for heavy snows that are too hard to push, but useless in lighter snows that I could just slide to the side of the driveway. Do it's not terrible, but it's not all-purpose either.
customer_reviews.author: booklover777

customer_reviews.title: as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Definitely an improvement in lifting the slushy junk from the end of the drive way. Impressed that the metal at the end (that scrapes against the cement) isn't the typical cheap quick pressed/folded sliver of metal that you find on the typical snow shovel. It actually looks substantial and should hold up for a while.
customer_reviews.author: andrzej raczynski

customer_reviews.title: Good shovel
customer_reviews.text: So I do like shovel, however, it can be purchased cheaper at my local big box store (by $5), so that's a bit annoying. That aside, I do like the function of this shovel. I have used it several times so far. I did not actually understand how much easier it would be to use two hands in the same area to pitch the snow away vice hunched over a shovel. For that, I like it.
customer_reviews.author: JIM

customer_reviews.title: A different approach to a show shovel
customer_reviews.text: The second handle has proved to be a nice addition. The shovel is light weight. It works well with dry snow. I do not recommend it for wet snow. The biggest issue is the high price. If you are where you can shop, a similar quality shovel ais priced at about 1/3 this shovel - but without the 2nd handle. I wouldn't purchase this shovel at the Amazon price again. .
customer_reviews.author: SDG

customer_reviews.title: A Small, Light Shovel That Holds Very Little Snow
customer_reviews.text: Read the description carefully. While 18" may sound wide, it is not. The shovel holds very little snow so the extra "handle" is superfluous. And I am not muscle bound; I'm 71 and this shovel offers no challenge.Perhaps the larger model would have been a smarter (albeit, more expensive) choice.
customer_reviews.author: Honest John

customer_reviews.title: This does work! But not built to last!
customer_reviews.text: This shovel definitely works as advertised. Going back and fourth between it and a conventional shovel, this one is much easier on the back. The "interface" between the flexible fulcrum and the main shaft of the shovel is the possible weak spot I've identified. Whether it stands up over the long term will be something I'd have to add as an edit onto this review. I've only had the shovel now for a few weeks and used it a few times, so can only comment now on the functionality, not the long term quality. EDIT -- 2/19/2019 -- Handle just broke off during normal use.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Very good shovel.
customer_reviews.text: I tried out a few other shovels last winter and none of them were very well designed nor did they have just a enough heft to cut into the snow, yet still be light enough not to wear me out. I used this one during our most recent snowstorm a few days ago, and I was quite pleased with it. The extra handle, though sometimes awkward, made a surprising difference.
customer_reviews.author: Soggyinseattle

customer_reviews.title: Shoveled 8+" after a storm
customer_reviews.text: So this shovel just survived trial by fire. We had a snow storm that left 8+" on the ground, then it rained slightly after and that left a layer of ice on top. Well, this was able to crack the ice, pick up the snow, and move it. I was able to do it without hurting my back or bending my legs all that much. I have a decent size driveway, so it got a lot of use.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Broadwater

customer_reviews.title: 2 North Dakota Winters and going strong!
customer_reviews.text: Great innovative product; the spring handle seemed very gimmicky at first, but it is by far the easiest shovel to use I've ever had. My only complaint is the blade edge is pretty dull and it flexes a bit, which means I cant really get under some of the tougher layers of compacted snow, and it doesn't cut into ice at all, which is why it failed to earn a 5th star for me. If they could put a beefier cutting edge on the front it would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: M. L. Mcconnell

customer_reviews.title: Not really a "super shovel"
customer_reviews.text: First, the handle meant to "lift" with (the extra one) is useless for pushing into the snow, so this creates a lot of awkward twisting stress on my back. Second, the scooping bucket is really weak and cheap, bending when it runs into compacted snow that my old snow shovel pushed right through. The whole unit is lightweight enough, but I would have paid extra for quality materials.
customer_reviews.author: J. Thiel

customer_reviews.title: I was skeptical ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a lot of shoveling to do. Being almost 74 and having a bad back (2 surgeries), I didn't think this would be much of an improvement over a traditional snow shovel. But I was wrong! Having 2 handholds, distributes the weight of the snow more evenly across my back, enabling me to do about half again as much as I would have using the old shovel. Plus is is much easier to sling the snow and get it over a fence where necessary. Definitely worth giving a try - I'm glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Mc.

customer_reviews.title: The lightness of the handle makes it easy to toss snow farther away
customer_reviews.text: OMG! Bought 3 of these shovels, one for myself, one for my adult son and one for our plow guy for Christmas. We all instantly noticed that there was no back pain when we shoveled wet, heavy or light snow. The lightness of the handle makes it easy to toss snow farther away. Excellent find!
customer_reviews.author: AnnieTop Contributor: Eye Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Back saving shovel in snow country!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! Living at Lake Tahoe, with feet of snow, my traditional shovel was getting painful to use. Since getting the Snow Joe, everything has changed. Shoveling is so much easier, more efficient, and most important, safer for my back! It doesn't mean I can stop paying attention to my body when I'm shoveling. Just that when there's several inches or a foot or more of new snow, I can tackle it with less stress. And since I'm going to be 60 in a couple months, and have, in the past, had bad back issues, I am truly grateful.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Bleiweiss

customer_reviews.title: Back feels fine!
customer_reviews.text: Received the shovel this morning and had to go right to work. I'm really getting sick of the snow but until I can move to a more tropical locale, this shovel will do nicely. I had a curved handle shovel which was okay, but I still had to lift with my back. The extra handle makes it easier to toss the snow so you don't have to wait until the shovel is full before throwing it, you can more easily throw the snow a little at a time. It was sturdy enough to throw a full load of wet snow as well. Showed my neighbor and he ordered one 15 minutes later.
customer_reviews.author: Big Norge

customer_reviews.title: Questionable Build Quality and Materials - Ergonomic Funtion
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed at the materials used for the shovel. The main 'scoop' part of the shovel is a somewhat flimsy plastic. The metal edge looks to be loosely riveted into the plastic. I'm not confident in the longevity of this shovel. The ergonomic handle and function of the shovel are great, but I'm not sure this shovel will see multiple Wisconsin winters. Shovel is likely best suited for areas that see lighter snowfalls.
customer_reviews.author: mmc223

customer_reviews.title: The shovel is not too heavy, but the extra ...
customer_reviews.text: The shovel is not too heavy, but the extra handle is a bit awkward. It was, indeed, much easier for my back and shoulders, but ended up putting extra strain on my wrist and forearm. We've only had one major snowfall so far, so I'll experiment a little more before making a final decision if this is easier.
customer_reviews.author: A. H.

customer_reviews.title: Cleared off Sidewalk
customer_reviews.text: We didn't have a lot of snow this year, but when we did it was deep. Cleared off my sidewalk in a short period of time with the shovel. I'm 5ft so the height was perfect for me; I didn't have to bend as much as some folks said they did in the reviews. I had no problems with it; I was able to push the snow off and when it was too deep that shoveling was need I had no problems.
customer_reviews.author: branchc

customer_reviews.title: makes it easier to shovel snow
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice shovel. The second handle makes it easier to throw the snow but watch the video on youtube to show you how it works---the video on Amazon is a bit misleading. A great feature of this shovel is that it is lightweight, so you're not lifting the heavy shovel + heavy snow. There is a metal blade on the end of the shovel.
customer_reviews.author: EMR

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy, cheap, and really short handled. I see this lasting no time at all. *Edit. It lasted one use. Totally a waste of money and now time in returning.
customer_reviews.author: cdiesel

customer_reviews.title: Great shovel to reduce strain on back
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these - one purchased through QVC and one through another channel. Shoveling snow in UT is so much easier on my back than a regular snow shovel. I highly recommend this - even if you don't have back issues now. It's lightweight and performs well with light and heavy snow.
customer_reviews.author: CMC_UT

customer_reviews.title: Saves your back
customer_reviews.text: Used this during the Chicago winter storm in January 2019. It took care of 14'' pretty easily without breaking my back. It does put some strain on your shoulders, so I had to keep on switching hands every few minutes. It is quite sturdy, and stood up to some throwing around. One note: it is somewhat difficult to put together. The alignment isn't perfect. It took about 10 minutes of messing with it to get everything to click together.
customer_reviews.author: Simran and Sachin

customer_reviews.title: Greatest Snow Shovel Yet Invented
customer_reviews.text: This is the greatest shovel I have ever bought. I have used it for over two years now. I was skeptical about not having to bend my back at all, as I am only 5'7, but I don't have to bend my back at all. The price was high compared to traditional shovels, but given I didn't have to bend my back at all, it was well worth it. I don't see how future snow shovels could be improved upon on the basis of how well this one works.
customer_reviews.author: GuyinChi

customer_reviews.title: 4 stars
customer_reviews.text: Metal strip fell off after just a few uses so I sent it back for a replacement. Same thing happened with the second one after a couple uses as well. Now it's outside of warranty - checking to see just how good customer service is. Item was replaced no hassle and was only used 2 times this winter but it hasn't fallen apart. Upgrading review to 4 stars
customer_reviews.author: WOLFSSLAYER

customer_reviews.title: Easy on surfaces and back
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one- the first one is so great I had to make sure I had another so I can get help shoveling snow when the time comes! I highly recommend this- it was a lifesaver during last year’s big snow. I was able to clear my large driveway and decks quickly and without harming my back or the deck and aggregate concrete.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl A.

customer_reviews.title: It's not a snow boss
customer_reviews.text: I had a Snow Boss shovel....loved it! Broke after 5 years of heavy use. Couldn't find one so I settled on this....it is not the same....I mean nowhere near! This is gimicky, the Snow Boss actually makes you more comfortable while shoveling, keeps you from getting a sore back and makes you productive....this thing is just....awkward and made me sore.
customer_reviews.author: khoward

customer_reviews.title: Broke within two weeks
customer_reviews.text: The screw on the handle fell off within a week and the metal part at the bottom of the shovel broke after 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: A
